xcri_rank.text: Overall competitive ranking based on head-to-head race results. Lower rank = better athlete.

xcri_score.text: Simple scoring metric (1000 minus rank). Athletes ranked higher score higher.

scs_score.text: Season Composite Score - balances athlete performance, performance relative to race field, and race strength. Click for detailed breakdown.

scs_rank.text: Ranking based on SCS (Season Composite Score). May differ from XCRI Rank for tactical racers who win despite slower times.

races.text: Number of qualifying races completed this season. More races = more reliable ranking.

season_average.text: Average race performance (time per kilometer, course-adjusted). Worst race excluded if 3+ races.

h2h_record.text: Head-to-head win-loss record against other ranked athletes. Format: Wins-Losses (Win Rate %).

best_win.text: Rank of the highest-ranked athlete this athlete has defeated in direct competition.

quality_of_wins.text: Best opponent quality among athletes defeated (based on adjusted time per km). Faster pace = stronger competition.

saga_score.text: Season Adjusted Gap Average - measures gap-closing consistency. Higher scores indicate smaller gaps to top finishers. Higher is better.

saga_rank.text: Your ranking based on SAGA score. Rank #1 = highest SAGA score (best gap performance).

sewr_score.text: Season Equal-Weight Rating - overall season performance quality. Higher scores indicate better consistent performance. Higher is better.

sewr_rank.text: Your ranking based on SEWR score. Rank #1 = highest SEWR score (best season quality).

osma_score.text: Opponent SEWR Moving Average - measures strength of schedule. Higher scores indicate tougher competition faced. Higher is better.

osma_rank.text: Your ranking based on OSMA score. Rank #1 = highest OSMA score (toughest schedule faced).

team_rank.text: Overall team ranking based on sum of top 7 athletes' individual XCRI ranks.

team_score.text: Sum of top 7 athletes' XCRI ranks. Lower score is better (e.g., ranks 1+5+10+15+20+25+30 = 106).

avg_rank.text: Average XCRI rank of top 7 athletes. Provides context for team quality.

regional_rank.text: Team's position within their NCAA geographic region (e.g., '2nd in Great Lakes Region').

conference_rank.text: Team's position within their athletic conference (e.g., '1st in Big Ten').

top_runner.text: Team's #1 ranked athlete and their individual XCRI rank.

runner_7.text: Team's 7th-best athlete and their individual XCRI rank. Indicates team depth.

division.text: Select which NCAA division to view (D1, D2, D3, NAIA, NJCAA D1, NJCAA D2, NJCAA D3).

region.text: Filter teams by NCAA geographic region. Helps compare regional competition.

conference.text: Filter teams by athletic conference (e.g., Big Ten, SEC).

checkpoint_date.text: View rankings from a specific week during the season. Shows ranking evolution over time.

search.text: Search for athletes by name or school. Type at least 3 characters.

scs_score_link.text: Click to view detailed SCS component breakdown (AGS, SAGA, CPR, SEWR, OSMA, XCRI).

athlete_name_link.text: Click to view athlete's full profile, including race history and detailed statistics.

team_name_link.text: Click to view team roster and all athletes from this school.

refresh_button.text: Reload rankings from database. Rankings update weekly after new race results.

export_button.text: Download current rankings as Excel file (.xlsx) or CSV for your own analysis.

knockout_algorithm.text: Rankings based on Knockout Algorithm - uses head-to-head race results and pairwise comparisons.

scs_info.text: SCS (Season Composite Score) - statistical metric based on 17-step calculation. Used as tiebreaker.

tiebreaker_hierarchy.text: Tiebreaking order: 1) Most Recent Common Race, 2) Common Opponents, 3) Quality of Wins, 4) SCS

faq_link.text: View frequently asked questions about XCRI rankings and how they're calculated.

how_it_works.text: Learn how the Knockout Algorithm builds rankings using head-to-head comparisons.

glossary.text: View definitions of technical terms used in the XCRI system.
